result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick Richard Hupf Jr

records.addlTxt:
4:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Patrick Richard Hupf Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney George Andrew Limbeck appeared by video for Patrick Richard Hupf Jr. 
Defense received discovery but has not received an offer. 
Deft. has been approved for a bed at pathways treatment facility, would like to amend bond with supplemental.
Attorney Limbeck to prepare draft. Court will grant Deft. opportunity to attend treatment and amends bond to a $2500 signature bond. *must be equipped with GPS before he goes to treatment*
Instructions on How to Appear Remotely by Zoom for the week of June 6, 2022
Status conference on June 6, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

01:48 PM Defendant Patrick Richard Hupf in court with attorney George Andrew Limbeck both by Zoom.  Defendant Patrick Richard Hupf in custody.  Grant D Scaife appeared for the Wisconsin, State of in person.
Patrick Richard Hupf appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant waives right to an in-person hearing today.
  Preliminary hearing questionnaire & waiver filed. Probable Cause Found, Defendant bound over. Information filed/reading waived, Not guilty plea entered by the Court.
Atty Limbeck states revocation petition currently filed on another case, requests late May or early June status date.
  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
